Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Frostbite \Frost`bite"\, v. t. To expose to the effect of frost, or a frosty air; to blight or nip with frost. [1913 Webster]
My wife up and with Mrs. Pen to walk in the fields to frostbite themselves. --Pepys. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Frostbite \Frost"bite\, n. The freezing, or effect of a freezing, of some part of the body, as the ears, fingers, toes, or nose. Severe frostbite can lead to the loss of fingers or toes. --Kane.
frostbite n : destruction of tissue by freezing and characterized by tingling, blistering and possibly gangrene [syn: {cryopathy}]
